TopicTitle: Where did your username come from?

Articles.Content: (insert interesting reason here)
Spock was taken. Besides I thought Red Shirt just sounded more Kerbal.
I've been playing with Rubik's cube since I was seven years old.
Because it's my first name, and then-GET THIS-my last initial!  So creative, right?
Changed it from Kaboom! Kaboom! cam from me not knowing what to put and HoloYolo because I am a little bit of an anime fan.
I do a few things... one of which is professional musician, in particular a guitarist. My main guitar is a Stratocaster, and my main stage amp is a Vox. Hence... stratvox.

My username is also my Minecraft username and some other stuff too. 

Where I came up with my Minecraft username, I do not know. 

And my real name is not max.

Well, I don't really know.  When I signed up for the forums, it just struck me.  Before this, I just used something with my initials in it.

Edited April 8, 2016 by Mad Rocket Scientist

It all began in 2009, when I made a LEGO account. I had to have Lego in it, and I was a huge fan of the Star Wars clone troopers at the time.

LEGO+Clone Troopers+2009=legoclone09
I went through a lego Mindstorms phase a couple years back, left the stage but the username stuck. Haven't used it for anything new in a while.

Mine came from the Family Guy cartoon )) Stewie Griffin )
and here its just my name

It started several years ago when my friend created a "ghetto name generator". The idea is that you take the first letter of your last name, than the first syllable of your first name twice. I would claim that his generator has a 90% success rate (failure being the creation of a name that sounds to silly/stupid to use). 

Well, if it wasn't before, my first name is now known to everyone on the forum. And I've also stated where I live... Maybe I'm getting a little too carefree with Internet security...

I first saw mine as an end boss in a digimon game for PlayStation and thought it sounded badS.

Shortly after I learnt it first entered the English lexicon from Nuclear weapons development, describing their effects. Mega = million, of course. Also, that it was the name of a heavy metal band. That I don't like them was irrelevant.

I've used it for lots of games and related media since.

I created my username by sitting in front of a computer for 15 minutes wondering what to use. Eventually I decided on KerbalSaver because that's something I always do, rescue kerbals. That and because I was tired of trying to think of a good username.

Back when Messenger was a thing (maybe like 7 or 8 years ago), I tried creating a Microsoft account with my last name (korhonen) but it was already taken so I had it suggest other usernames instead. One of the suggestions was "cpt_korhonen" and I picked that one.

Edited April 8, 2016 by CaptainKorhonen
Where's @Endersmens? I think it's kinda obvious anyway but still.

45 minutes ago, max_creative said:

Where's @Endersmens? I think it's kinda obvious anyway but still.

I'm here!  yes, created it as a minecraft screen name. Didn't really like it but it stuck. Kinda hard to pronounce, so I also accept Ender and Enders.
from a charming little feller named oppenheimer.
I wonder where @Felbourn's name came from

My initials, plus my previous home address. Nothing too special.

On the other hand, my Minecraft username is UnorthodoxKerbal.

6 hours ago, insert_name said:

I wonder where @Felbourn's name came from

Fel is a demonic energy in a game I programmed. Bourn in a fantasy context means "originated from" so all together... I originate from demonic energy.

When I first got my Minecraft account in 2012, I wanted to make my username WillBLEpic, because my name is william, my last initials are BL, and I thought epic was a cool word. For some reason, the site didn't like it, so I added a three instead of the E. Willbl3pic. I now use it for everything. Before that, I used williambl. So original.

There is this indie game called Ring Runner, and one of the spaceships in it is called R5FC Aozora Nine. I thought it sounded cool, so I based my username off that.  

Aozora is blue sky in Japanese.

My name came from playing the Dayz mod on arma 2 to try and fool everyone when i was doing bandit stuff in the towns. Worked a few times when they tried to call me out over side chat and eventually confused them to the point where they didn't know who they were talking about anymore
Not very creative... K (add K to everything rule) + HAL 9000 (HUGE Space Odyssey fan). But I like it.
